page.title: 17BUNYAN CHAPEL, PRESTON
page.content: Preston has had a long connection with the Baptists. About 1640_1650 Colonel Sadleir,Lord of Temple Dinsley and Sir John Read,Lord of the manor of Minsden were open and professed Baptists. John Bunyan's family were associated with the district long before he began preaching locally. He held meetings in Wain Wood,Preston,at dead of night,to avoid discovery. A cottage still stands in the wood where Bunyan is said to have hidden his bible in the inglenook. In 1689,the Toleration Act was passed enabling people to worship as they pleased, and at the beginning of the 18th century,a Baptist meeting place was set up in Preston. During the ministry of John Aldis of Hitchin, from 1868_1877,it was decided to build a Bunyan Chapel in the village. This chapel is still in use today.
